meanings.definition: A person who criticizes or speaks ill of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The detractors of the new policy were vocal in their disapproval.
meanings.sent2: The movie received mixed reviews, with some detractors calling it boring.
meanings.sent3: The detractors at the comedy show couldn't stop laughing at the jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her detractors were like shadows, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The detractors' words stung like a swarm of angry bees.

meanings.definition: To take away a part from; diminish.
meanings.sent1: The storm detractors the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The loud music detractors from the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: Adding too many toppings can detractors from the flavor of the pizza.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude detractors from the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti detractors from the historical significance of the monument.
